posts.post_content: This card is just outright better than many of its alternatives, even in legacy. Cryptic Command tells your opponent to sit down and shut up. Even if cryptic command lost an option like to bounce or draw, it would still be powerful enough to see constructed play.

This card is just outright better than many of its alternatives, even in legacy. Cryptic Command tells your opponent to sit down and shut up. Even if cryptic command lost an option like to bounce or draw, it would still be powerful enough to see constructed play.

Posted By: Pwnsaw (9/16/2009 12:07:14 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
There are so many things you can do with this [Command](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Command), this card is incredibly amazing and completely worth the cost.   
  
It's like a cantrip version of [Counterspell](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Counterspell) and [Boomerang](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Boomerang) in one, plus you can also play those two effects without drawing a card instead, or even either prevent your opponents creatures one turn from attacking and/or make yours afterwards effectively unblockable - while still getting the option to a bounce, hardcounter or card draw.  
  
That card is a constructed bomb and on the edge on being broken, yet as [the Jitte](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=81979) rather very powerful than overpowered.  
  
To quote Trancefo, that's indeed *pure blue*.
posts.html:
There are so many things you can do with this Command, this card is incredibly amazing and completely worth the cost.

It's like a cantrip version of Counterspell and Boomerang in one, plus you can also play those two effects without drawing a card instead, or even either prevent your opponents creatures one turn from attacking and/or make yours afterwards effectively unblockable - while still getting the option to a bounce, hardcounter or card draw.

That card is a constructed bomb and on the edge on being broken, yet as the Jitte rather very powerful than overpowered.

To quote Trancefo, that's indeed pure blue.

Posted By: EpicSeven (6/22/2009 5:55:52 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: Love this card, why? Because counter spells take such perfect planning that sometimes you can't use one when you want to and then it sits there in your hand.. ie, you use it to soon, you don't have enough mana to play the counter spell and your creatures, so on and etc. With this card at the very least if you can't counter spell anything you can still use it to do something else, and I like that a lot.

posts.post_content:
I got a question about this card. So, suppose one guy plays Cryptic Command, choosing to counter a spell and bounce a permanent. Then, the other person, in response, uses Vedalken Mastermind (or something similar to that effect) to bounce the permanent that was targeted back to their hand. So, Cryptic Command lost its bounce target. So, does the whole spell fizzle or is the other spell still countered?  
  
Also, this card is awesome, for the record.
posts.html:

posts.post_content:
[Wtf Wizards?](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=141830)  
  
Let's switch the power levels of Cryptic Command and [Incendiary Command](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=141830).  
  
Cryptic (the worst of the commands):  
Counter target Sorcery spell  
Return target creature to its owner's hand  
Change all instances of a color word on target spell or permanent  
Look at the top four cards of your library and put them back in any order  
(I don't know if all of that text could fit on a card)  
  
[Incendiary](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=141830) (best command, $10, this would be an instant)  
Deal 4 damage to target *creature or* player  
Deal 2 damage to each creature  
Destroy target *artifact or* land  
(hmmm..... so far, this is still about $3)  
Put a 5/5 red dragon creature token with flying in to play  
  
hmmmm...... obviously and overly useful- I like it. Perhaps the dragon would actually be a 4/4.
posts.html:
